Uses of Class
com.uttt.common.ExUtil

  • Packages that use ExUtil 
    Package Description
    com.uttt.common
    A common utility package with small, focused helper classes for use throughout the UTTT code base.

    • Uses of ExUtil in com.uttt.common

      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.append(java.lang.Integer flags, java.lang.Object... messages)
      Append a sequence of items (varags) onto the pending exception's detail message.

      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident)
      Note the given identifier text for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, char value)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, double value)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, double value, java.lang.String format)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content, using the given format to convert the value to string text.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, long value)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, long value, java.lang.String format)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content, using the given format to convert the value to string text.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, java.lang.Object value)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.ident(java.lang.String ident, java.lang.String value)
      Note the given identifier text and value for later use as part of the early (leftwards) message content.
      ExUtil<T> ExUtil.tackon(java.lang.String message)
      For fine-grained control by the caller, this method will simply append the given string onto the exception's message accumulation buffer with no separator logic at all.
